circumstances: En route from Las Vegas to Houston, the left engine failed. The pilot was able to feather the propeller but unable to maintain a safe altitude. He informed ATC about his situation and was cleared to divert to the nearest airport for an emergency landing. While trying to land at a ranch airstrip, the airplane hit a wood pile and crashed in flamers. The pilot and a passenger were seriously injured while four other occupants were killed.
probable_cause:
Failure of the left engine in flight due to cylinder assembly failure. The following factors were reported: 
- Material failure, 
- Improper in-flight decisions or planning, 
- Improper emergency procedures, 
- Intentional wheels-up landing, 
- Left engine lost power due to cracked n°9 cylinder.
